title: Asana Product Tour Review: Intuitive Onboarding and Guided Experience
content: Asana offers a comprehensive and generally well-regarded approach to its product tour and onboarding experience, catering to both individual users and organizational needs. Key aspects include an intuitive initial setup that guides new users through account creation, first project setup, and task addition, allowing customization of views and task statuses early on. Rather than a rigid, forced product tour, Asana employs subtle 'hotspots'—small, pulsing droplet shapes—to draw attention to key actions, enabling users to explore the platform at their own pace without being overwhelmed. For those upgrading to Asana Business, a 'second onboarding experience' highlights new premium features with concise copy, clear headers, and informative illustrations, making the upgrade feel valuable. Asana also provides a wealth of external learning resources, including video tutorials, a detailed help center, and 'getting started' guides, along with a quick tour for navigation. Beyond product feature tours, Asana is widely used by organizations to manage employee onboarding processes, enabling HR and managers to create structured onboarding project templates with tasks, due dates, and custom fields. User feedback generally praises Asana's user-friendly interface and ease of initial setup, appreciating the flexibility to customize workflows and project views. While the interface is intuitive, some users note a 'notable learning curve for new adopters' as they delve into more advanced features. The subtle nature of the in-app product tour, using hotspots, is often highlighted as a positive aspect of the user experience.
